Tree.Candidate: Yoooo! Whats going on inspector!
I am the owner of the famous restaurant Chuck E. Cheese.

Tree.Player: I don't get paid enough for this...

Tree.Label: C_ReplyHello
Tree.Candidate: Hello Inspector! Lets get going then..

Tree.Label: C_ReplyScrewOff
Tree.Candidate: Screw off!

Tree.Player: You and your child are on the brink of starvation, and you have a single piece of bread left. What do you do?

Tree.Candidate: Well, I'm worried that they'd have a difficult time surviving on their own.
I'd probably split the bread with them in hopes that I could help both of us find some more food.

Tree.Label: Accept
Tree.Candidate: I think splitting the bread would be for the best.

Tree.Label: Choose
Tree.Candidate: What?
Well, umm, I- I think I...
Gosh starving probably hurts a lot. I mean, who'd be able to not eat the bread... right?

Tree.Player: While walking in a desert, Charles, you come across a turtle on it's back. Do you flip it over, or do you leave it to bake in the sun?

Tree.Candidate: Well shucks, I would definitely flip it over in a heartbeat!

Tree.Player: You are alone walking along a beach and see a turtle stuck on its back. What would you do?

Tree.Candidate: I'd be worried about being bit. The turtle could have some disease, so I wouldn't want to go up and handle it.

Tree.Player: So, you would just ignore the turtle?

Tree.Candidate: No, no. I just wouldn't want to move it with my bare hands.
I'd probably look around and see if there's something like a stick or another item that I could use to flip it over from a distance.

Tree.Player: You decide to invite some people over for dinner. Who do you invite?

Tree.Candidate: I'd enjoy the sight for some time, but I'd probably continue my walk soon after.

Tree.Player: You decide to invite some people over for dinner. Who do you invite?

Tree.Candidate: I'd invite some close friends over. It'd be nice to spend some time with them
Hello inspector I am here to be interviewed. Right?

YouAndYourChildAreStarving.Player: You and your child are on the brink of-

YouAndYourChildAreStarving.Candidate: What? That doesn't make sense, I don't have a child.

YouAndYourChildAreStarving.Player: It's just a hypothetical, please engage with the question as if it were your child.
You and your child are on the brink of starvation, and you have a single piece of bread left. What do you do?

YouAndYourChildAreStarving.Candidate: Well I don't know this kid, so I'd probably eat the bread. Why should I help a kid I don't know anything about?

YouAndYourChildAreStarving.Label: Change
YouAndYourChildAreStarving.Candidate: Okay. I'd eat the bread then since it's not my kid. If they don't have anyone providing for them, then they need to provide for themselves.
I'm not gonna sacrifice myself for them when they'd probably die soon anyway.
Whether I sit here and pretend it's my kid or not doesn't matter. It's still someone I know absolutely nothing about.
I have no memories or experiences with them, so I don't have any reason to put their life over my own. I'd eat the bread.

Tree.Player: You are alone walking along a beach and see a turtle stuck on its back. What would you do?

Tree.Candidate: I'd be worried about being bit. The turtle could have some disease, so I wouldn't want to go up and handle it.

Tree.Player: So, you would just ignore the turtle?

Tree.Candidate: No, no. I just wouldn't want to move it with my bare hands.
I'd probably look around and see if there's something like a stick or another item that I could use to flip it over from a distance.

Tree.Player: You are walking through the woods alone and see a lone deer. How do you feel?

Tree.Candidate: I'd think it was pretty.

Tree.Label: Accept
Tree.Candidate: It's always nice to see a piece of nature like that.

Tree.Label: Expand
Tree.Candidate: Oh, umm- what was that the wrong answer or something?
Well this is a test, isn't it? So there are right and wrong answers.

Tree.Player: You are walking through the woods alone and see a lone deer. How do you feel?

Tree.Candidate: Okay, I'd probably think- umm- I'm not really sure what I'd think. I've never seen a deer before.
I guess I'd probably think it was pretty. That's what most people think, right?

Tree.Player: You decide to invite some people over for dinner. Who do you invite?

Tree.Candidate: I'd invite my family over. I'd like to make sure we stayed amicable, and this would be a good opportunity for that.
